title: simple soba noodles
ingredients: 1 Tbsp grated ginger; don’t need to peel if it’s fresh
toasted white sesame seeds; for garnish
instructions: Put water up to boil. Combine shoyu, sesame oil, rice vinegar, ginger and sliced scallion in a cup. Add a splash or water or dashi.
Once soba noodles are barely cooked through, strain and rinse under cold water. Place in bowl and top with sauce and garnishes. That’s it.
notes: Maybe more ginger. Serves 1 as a large meal, 2 as small. Could drop to 150g for a single portion. Good side for a larger Japanese meal.
